*Automatically generated by the [Swagger Codegen](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:
1. Java 1.7+
2. Maven/Gradle

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>com.kodypay</groupId>
  <artifactId>kody-clientsdk-http-client</artifactId>
  <version>1.0.0</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
compile "com.kodypay:kody-clientsdk-http-client:1.0.0"
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

* `target/kody-clientsdk-http-client-1.0.0.jar`
* `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java

import com.kodypay.api.*;
import com.kodypay.api.model.*;
import com.kodypay.api.KodyPayTerminalServiceApi;

public class KodyPayTerminalServiceApiExample {

  public static void main(String[] args) {

    KodyPayTerminalServiceApi apiInstance = new KodyPayTerminalServiceApi();
    String storeId = "storeId_example"; // String | UUID of store
    String terminalId = "terminalId_example"; // String | to identify the terminal where the payment was sent
    CancelRequest body = new CancelRequest(); // RequiresXAPIKeyHeaderWithAPIKeyValue | 
    try {
      CancelResponse result = apiInstance.kodyPayTerminalServiceCancel(storeId, terminalId, body);
      System.out.println(result);
    } catch (ApiException e) {
      System.err.println("Exception when calling KodyPayTerminalServiceApi#kodyPayTerminalServiceCancel");
      e.printStackTrace();
    }
  }
}

```

## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `ApiClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.
